title: Ithaca Bus Station
text:
Ithaca Bus Station, also referred to as Ithaca Bus Terminal, is an <a href="intercity%20bus">intercity</a> bus station in <a href="Ithaca%2C%20New%20York">Ithaca</a>, the <a href="county%20seat">county seat</a> and only city in <a href="Tompkins%20County%2C%20New%20York">Tompkins County, New York</a>. The <a href="Prairie%20School">Prairie-style</a> building, located west of North Fulton Street between West Seneca Street and West State Street, was designed by architect <a href="Frank%20J.%20Nies">Frank J. Nies</a> in 1912 as a train station of the <a href="Delaware%2C%20Lackawanna%20and%20Western%20Railroad">Delaware, Lackawanna and Western Railroad</a>. DL&W ceased passenger operations in 1942, and Greyhound Bus Lines acquired the station in 1967. The station building accommodates waiting area with seats, ticketing and package express office, and restrooms.<br>
The station closed in October 2018 due to construction, retirement of the station operators, and changing infrastructure in the area. Buses are now boarding downtown for the time being until long term plans are made. The City of Ithaca designated the station as a local landmark in January 2019.

Bus routes.
The station is on the Greyhound routes from New York City to <a href="Buffalo%2C%20New%20York">Buffalo</a> or <a href="Rochester%2C%20New%20York">Rochester</a> daily, and from <a href="Syracuse%2C%20New%20York">Syracuse</a> to <a href="Elmira%2C%20New%20York">Elmira</a> daily. It is also on the ShortLine route from New York or <a href="Binghamton">Binghamton</a> to <a href="Cornell%20North%20Campus">Cornell North Campus</a> (CC Lot) daily, New York to <a href="Ithaca%20College">Ithaca College</a> (Park Communications Bldg.), and <a href="Albany%2C%20New%20York">Albany</a> to Cornell North Campus. The Greyhound routes operated by Trailways of New York are not available on the operator Trailways' official website.
Connecting transportation.
The Route 14 (West Hill–Hospital–Commons) of <a href="Tompkins%20Consolidated%20Area%20Transit">Tompkins Consolidated Area Transit (TCAT)</a> serves Ithaca Bus Station at a curbside stop, bounding for <a href="Cayuga%20Medical%20Center">Cayuga Medical Center</a> daily, while the route also serves the bus station at State Street and Fulton Street, a curbside stop across State Street, for Green Street at <a href="Ithaca%20Commons">Ithaca Commons</a> daily.
TCAT Route 20 (Enfield–Commons) and 21 (Trumansburg–Commons) also serves the station at Seneca Street and Fulton Street, a curbside stop across Seneca Street, for <a href="Enfield%2C%20New%20York">Enfield</a> Highway Department and Aubles Trailer Park in <a href="Trumansburg%2C%20New%20York">Trumansburg</a> daily.
